title: Saudi Attack Hits Oil and Markets, The Great U.S.-China Decoupling, New Startup Rents Lawyers to Other Startups
itunes:title: Saudi Attack Hits Oil and Markets, The Great U.S.-China Decoupling, New Startup Rents Lawyers to Other Startups
description:
Peter Tchir and Rear Admiral Mark Heinrich of Academy Securities discuss the political and market implications of the drone strike on Saudi oil field. Andy Browne, Bloomberg New Economy Editorial Director, explains why the U.S. and China will not have a sweeping, once-and-for-all trade settlement and that the two economies are decoupling. Bloomberg Businessweek Features Editor Max Chafkin talks about how startup Atrium is renting lawyers to other startups. Bloomberg News Sustainability Editor Emily Chasan discusses the Covering Climate Now initiative.Brad Ball, CEO at Liquid Strategies, talks about embracing market volatility. Geralyn Breig, CEO at Anytown USA, explains the importance of vetting online sellers for identity and origin.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
